intro: Cyanopsis decurrens, commonly known as the bluebells of the genus Cyanopsis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and clusters of small, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a mild aromatic scent. Cyanopsis decurrens is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
